section.title: Too, enough, very
section.sectiontitle: Use too + adjective or not + adjective + enough when something is a problem.
section.text1a: His suitcase was too heavy to carry.
section.text2a: He wasn't strong enough to carry his suitcase.
section.sectiontitle2: Use very when something is difficult but not impossible.
section.text3a: His suitcase was very heavy but he carried it.
section.text4a: The competition was very fierce but I won.

section.title: Too, enough, very
section.sectiontitle: Use too much with uncountable nouns. Use too many with countable nouns.
section.text1a: I can't hear you because there's too much noise in here.
section.text2a: There are too many books on that shelf.
section.sectiontitle2: Use enough after adjectives and adverbs and before nouns.
section.text3a: That bag isn't big enough for all these things.
section.text4a: Sorry, I didn't have enough time to finish my homework.
